title: Home and Away's Sam Frost reveals her struggle with mental health
text:
Home and Away's Sam Frost has revealed her struggle with mental health left her 'riddled with pain' and unable to cope.

On Saturday, the actress admitted she reached a breaking point in 2016 when her radio show with Rove McManus was on facing the axe.

She also struggled dealing with online hate after her highly-publicised splits with Bachelor Blake Garvey and Bachelorette winner Sasha Mielczarek.

'I felt like I couldn't do it anymore. I couldn't stop crying': On Saturday, Home and Away star Sam Frost (pictured) revealed her mental health battles have left her feeling 'riddled with pain'

Speaking to The Herald Sun, Sam said: 'All of those things just piled up and I felt like I couldn't do it anymore'.

She added: 'I remember talking to my sister, Kristine, one night and I was so upset, I couldn't stop crying. I just felt like my whole body was riddled with pain and that there was no way I could make it go away.'

Sam explained that mental health is a lifelong struggle for her and may have been passed down from her mother, who also struggled with similar issues.

Pressure: Sam says her mental health reached breaking point in 2016 when her radio show Rove and Sam was on the ropes. Pictured with Rove McManus on the since-cancelled show

High-profile splits: The star also says online hate following her highly-publicised break ups with Sasha (left) and Blake (right) triggered an emotional response

'My mum, Debbie, has dealt with mental disorders as well, and when I was younger I was embarrassed by them.

'Nobody talked about mental health 15 years ago, so when I started to show similar patterns (to my mother), I was worried I'd be labelled as crazy,' she said.

Ahead of World Mental Health Day on Thursday, Sam is happy that people are more openly talking about the stigmatised issue.

Family: Sam explained that mental health is a lifelong struggle for her and may have been passed down from her mother, who also struggled with similar issues

Candid: 'My mum, Debbie, has dealt with mental disorders as well, and when I was younger I was embarrassed by them. Nobody talked about mental health 15 years ago, so when I started to show similar patterns (to my mother), I was worried I'd be labelled as crazy,' she said

The Home and Away star is currently dating longtime friend Dave Bashford after becoming an item in 2017.

In August, Dave penned an emotional letter about supporting Sam through her struggle with depression and anxiety.

'When things start to get tough for her I will listen and give some voice of reason, but most importantly I will reassure her. She (Sam) doesn't need me to fix what is upsetting her,' he wrote.

Her rock: The Home and Away star is currently dating longtime friend Dave Bashford after becoming an item in 2017. In August, Dave (pictured) penned an emotional letter about supporting Sam through her struggle with depression and anxiety

Sam, who rose to fame on the Bachelor and Bachelorette, has long been a crusader for mental health, and in June last year, created the website Believe by Sam Frost.

Believe by Sam Frost is a collaborative project between Sam and her sister Kristine, aimed at providing 'help with navigating the sometimes toxic world of social media'.

If you or anyone you know is struggling, call Lifeline 13 11 14.
